s.text: Protein secondary structure was predicted using a multiple alignment as the input for the JPRED and PHD programs [ 42 43 44 ] . Preliminary clustering of proteins was done using the BLASTCLUST program with empirically determined length and score threshold cut off values (For documentation see ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/blast/documents/README.bcl).

These observations suggest that the N-terminal-most domain of the SGCs is evolutionarily mobile: it occurs in several distinct contexts with other domains in the same polypeptide, or in a stand-alone form.

The co-occurrence of the HNOB and the HNOBA domains in either the same protein or proteins encoded by the same operon suggests a strong functional interaction between them.

The N-terminal part of the domain contains a universally conserved acidic residue that may play a critical role creating the local environment for NO selectivity.

All versions of the HNOBA domain, except one from Rhodobacter sphaeroides , contain a conserved histidine between the core region and the long C-terminal ?-helix that links it to a kinase or cyclase domain (Fig.

All versions of the HNOBA domain, except one from Rhodobacter sphaeroides , contain a conserved histidine between the core region and the long C-terminal ?-helix that links it to a kinase or cyclase domain (Fig.

The soluble guanylyl cyclases are important signaling molecules in animals that transduce signals mediated by the gaseous first messenger, nitric oxide [ 16 17 18 19 ] . In animals, NO functions as a neurotransmitter both in the central and peripheral nervous system.
It is predicted to adopt an ? + ? fold that is possibly related to the PAS-like fold.

These include the PAS-like fold, which is the scaffold of the PAS [ 11 12 ] , GAF [ 13 ] , and probably the CACHE [ 14 ] superfamilies, and the ACT-like fold, which is seen in ACT, ferredoxin and related ligand-binding domains [ 4 15 ] . Identification of such conserved domains has, often, improved our understanding of the general structural and biochemical features that underlie protein-small molecule interactions.

A similar secondary structure pattern is also observed in several other ligand-binding domains such as the PAS, GAF, profilin and probably even the CACHE domains [ 10 ] . Sequence-structure threading using the 3DPSSM method detected the PAS domain (Photoactive yellow protein PDB: 1drm) with marginally significant scores (.5, 50-70% probability of correct fold prediction).
It is predicted to adopt an ? + ? fold that is possibly related to the PAS-like fold.

In the low GC Gram-positive bacteria and Desulfovibrio desulfuricans they occur in combination with the methyl accepting chemotaxis receptor proteins, with or without the HAMP domain [ 29 30 ] .
